org.kurento.room

Class SyncRoomManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kurento.room.SyncRoomManager

  • public class SyncRoomManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The Kurento room manager represents an SDK for any developer that wants to implement the Room server-side application. They can build their application on top of the manager’s Java API and implement their desired business logic without having to consider room or media-specific details.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SyncRoomManager(RoomHandler roomHandler, KurentoClientProvider kcProvider)
      Provides an instance of the room manager by setting a room handler and the KurentoClient provider.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SyncRoomManager

        public SyncRoomManager(RoomHandler roomHandler,
               KurentoClientProvider kcProvider)
        Provides an instance of the room manager by setting a room handler and the KurentoClient provider.
        Parameters:
        roomHandler - the room handler implementation
        kcProvider - enables the manager to obtain Kurento Client instances

    • Method Detail

      • joinRoom

        public java.util.Set<UserParticipant> joinRoom(java.lang.String userName,
                                      java.lang.String roomName,
                                      boolean webParticipant,
                                      java.lang.String participantId)
                                        throws AdminException
        Represents a client’s request to join a room. The room must exist in order to perform the join.
        Dev advice: Send notifications to the existing participants in the room to inform about the new peer.
        Parameters:
        userName - name or identifier of the user in the room. Will be used to identify her WebRTC media peer (from the client-side).
        roomName - name or identifier of the room
        webParticipant - if true, the internal media endpoints will use the trickle ICE mechanism when establishing connections with external media peers (WebRtcEndpoint); if false, the media endpoints will be of type RtpEndpoint, with no ICE implementation
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Returns:
        set of existing peers of type UserParticipant, can be empty if first
        Throws:
        AdminException - on error while joining (like the room is not found or is closing)

      • leaveRoom

        public java.util.Set<UserParticipant> leaveRoom(java.lang.String participantId)
                                         throws AdminException
        Represents a client’s notification that she’s leaving the room. Will also close the room if there're no more peers.
        Dev advice: Send notifications to the other participants in the room to inform about the one that's just left.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Returns:
        set of remaining peers of type UserParticipant, if empty this method has closed the room
        Throws:
        AdminException - on error leaving the room

      • publishMedia

        public java.lang.String publishMedia(java.lang.String participantId,
                            boolean isOffer,
                            java.lang.String sdp,
                            MediaElement loopbackAlternativeSrc,
                            MediaType loopbackConnectionType,
                            boolean doLoopback,
                            MediaElement... mediaElements)
                              throws AdminException
        Represents a client’s request to start streaming her local media to anyone inside the room. The media elements should have been created using the same pipeline as the publisher's. The streaming media endpoint situated on the server can be connected to itself thus realizing what is known as a loopback connection. The loopback is performed after applying all additional media elements specified as parameters (in the same order as they appear in the params list).
        Dev advice: Send notifications to the existing participants in the room to inform about the new stream that has been published. Answer to the peer's request by sending it the SDP response (answer or updated offer) generated by the WebRTC endpoint on the server.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        isOffer - if true, the sdp is an offer from remote, otherwise is the answer to the offer generated previously by the server endpoint
        sdp - SDP String offer or answer, that's been generated by the client’s WebRTC peer
        loopbackAlternativeSrc - instead of connecting the endpoint to itself, use this MediaElement as source
        loopbackConnectionType - the connection type for the loopback; if null, will stream both audio and video media
        doLoopback - loopback flag
        mediaElements - variable array of media elements (filters, recorders, etc.) that are connected between the source WebRTC endpoint and the subscriber endpoints
        Returns:
        the SDP response generated by the WebRTC endpoint on the server (answer to the client's offer or the updated offer previously generated by the server endpoint)
        Throws:
        AdminException - on error

      • publishMedia

        public java.lang.String publishMedia(java.lang.String participantId,
                            boolean isOffer,
                            java.lang.String sdp,
                            boolean doLoopback,
                            MediaElement... mediaElements)
                              throws AdminException
        Same as publishMedia(String, boolean, String, MediaElement, MediaType, boolean, MediaElement...) , using as loopback the published stream and no specific type of loopback connection.
        Throws:
        AdminException
        See Also:
        #publishMedia(String, boolean, String, boolean, MediaElement, MediaElement...)

      • publishMedia

        public java.lang.String publishMedia(java.lang.String participantId,
                            boolean isOffer,
                            java.lang.String sdp,
                            MediaType loopbackConnectionType,
                            boolean doLoopback,
                            MediaElement... mediaElements)
                              throws AdminException
        Same as publishMedia(String, boolean, String, MediaElement, MediaType, boolean, MediaElement...) , using as loopback the published stream and allowing a specific connection type.
        Throws:
        AdminException
        See Also:
        #publishMedia(String, boolean, String, boolean, MediaElement, MediaElement...)

      • generatePublishOffer

        public java.lang.String generatePublishOffer(java.lang.String participantId)
                                      throws AdminException
        Represents a client’s request to initiate the media connection from the server-side (generate the SDP offer and send it back to the client) and must be followed by processing the SDP answer from the client in order to establish the streaming.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Returns:
        the SDP offer generated by the WebRTC endpoint on the server
        Throws:
        AdminException - on error
        See Also:
        #publishMedia(String, String, boolean, MediaElement...)

      • unpublishMedia

        public void unpublishMedia(java.lang.String participantId)
                    throws AdminException
        Represents a client’s request to stop publishing her media stream. All media elements on the server-side connected to this peer will be disconnected and released. The peer is left ready for publishing her media in the future.
        Dev advice: Send notifications to the existing participants in the room to inform that streaming from this endpoint has ended.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Throws:
        AdminException - on error

      • subscribe

        public java.lang.String subscribe(java.lang.String remoteName,
                         java.lang.String sdpOffer,
                         java.lang.String participantId)
                           throws AdminException
        Represents a client’s request to receive media from room participants that published their media. Will have the same result when a publisher requests its own media stream.
        Dev advice: Answer to the peer's request by sending it the SDP answer generated by the the receiving WebRTC endpoint on the server.
        Parameters:
        remoteName - identification of the remote stream which is effectively the peer’s name (participant)
        sdpOffer - SDP offer String generated by the client’s WebRTC peer
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Returns:
        the SDP answer generated by the receiving WebRTC endpoint on the server
        Throws:
        AdminException - on error

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe(java.lang.String remoteName,
               java.lang.String participantId)
                 throws AdminException
        Represents a client’s request to stop receiving media from the remote peer.
        Parameters:
        remoteName - identification of the remote stream which is effectively the peer’s name (participant)
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Throws:
        AdminException - on error

      • onIceCandidate

        public void onIceCandidate(java.lang.String endpointName,
                  java.lang.String candidate,
                  int sdpMLineIndex,
                  java.lang.String sdpMid,
                  java.lang.String participantId)
                    throws AdminException
        Request that carries info about an ICE candidate gathered on the client side. This information is required to implement the trickle ICE mechanism. Should be triggered or called whenever an icecandidate event is created by a RTCPeerConnection.
        Parameters:
        endpointName - the name of the peer whose ICE candidate was gathered
        candidate - the candidate attribute information
        sdpMLineIndex - the index (starting at zero) of the m-line in the SDP this candidate is associated with
        sdpMid - media stream identification, "audio" or "video", for the m-line this candidate is associated with
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Throws:
        AdminException - on error

      • addMediaElement

        public void addMediaElement(java.lang.String participantId,
                   MediaElement element)
                     throws AdminException
        Applies a media element (filter, recorder, mixer, etc.) to media that is currently streaming or that might get streamed sometime in the future. The element should have been created using the same pipeline as the publisher's.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the owner of the stream
        element - media element to be added
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist, has been closed or on error when applying the filter

      • addMediaElement

        public void addMediaElement(java.lang.String participantId,
                   MediaElement element,
                   MediaType type)
                     throws AdminException
        Applies a media element (filter, recorder, mixer, etc.) to media that is currently streaming or that might get streamed sometime in the future. The element should have been created using the same pipeline as the publisher's. The media connection can be of any type, that is audio, video, data or any (when the parameter is null).
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the owner of the stream
        element - media element to be added
        type - the connection type (null is accepted, has the same result as calling addMediaElement(String, MediaElement))
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist, has been closed or on error when applying the filter

      • removeMediaElement

        public void removeMediaElement(java.lang.String participantId,
                      MediaElement element)
                        throws AdminException
        Disconnects and removes media element (filter, recorder, etc.) from a media stream.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        element - media element to be removed
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist, has been closed or on error when removing the filter

      • mutePublishedMedia

        public void mutePublishedMedia(MutedMediaType muteType,
                      java.lang.String participantId)
                        throws AdminException
        Mutes the streamed media of this publisher in a selective manner.
        Parameters:
        muteType - which leg should be disconnected (audio, video or both)
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist, has been closed, is not publishing or on error when performing the mute operation

      • unmutePublishedMedia

        public void unmutePublishedMedia(java.lang.String participantId)
                          throws AdminException
        Reverts the effects of the mute operation.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist, has been closed, is not publishing or on error when reverting the mute operation

      • muteSubscribedMedia

        public void muteSubscribedMedia(java.lang.String remoteName,
                       MutedMediaType muteType,
                       java.lang.String participantId)
                         throws AdminException
        Mutes the incoming media stream from the remote publisher in a selective manner.
        Parameters:
        remoteName - identification of the remote stream which is effectively the peer’s name (participant)
        muteType - which leg should be disconnected (audio, video or both)
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist, has been closed, is not publishing or on error when performing the mute operation

      • unmuteSubscribedMedia

        public void unmuteSubscribedMedia(java.lang.String remoteName,
                         java.lang.String participantId)
                           throws AdminException
        Reverts any previous mute operation.
        Parameters:
        remoteName - identification of the remote stream which is effectively the peer’s name (participant)
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist, has been closed or on error when reverting the mute operation

      • close

        @PreDestroy
public void close()
        Closes all resources. This method has been annotated with the @PreDestroy directive (javax.annotation package) so that it will be automatically called when the RoomManager instance is container-managed.
        Dev advice: Send notifications to all participants to inform that their room has been forcibly closed.
        See Also:
        RoomManager.closeRoom(String)

      • getRooms

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getRooms()
        Returns all currently active (opened) rooms.
        Returns:
        set of the rooms’ identifiers (names)

      • getParticipants

        public java.util.Set<UserParticipant> getParticipants(java.lang.String roomName)
                                               throws AdminException
        Returns all the participants inside a room.
        Parameters:
        roomName - name or identifier of the room
        Returns:
        set of UserParticipant POJOS (an instance contains the participant’s identifier and her user name)
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the room doesn’t exist

      • getPublishers

        public java.util.Set<UserParticipant> getPublishers(java.lang.String roomName)
                                             throws AdminException
        Returns all the publishers (participants streaming their media) inside a room.
        Parameters:
        roomName - name or identifier of the room
        Returns:
        set of UserParticipant POJOS representing the existing publishers
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the room doesn’t exist

      • getSubscribers

        public java.util.Set<UserParticipant> getSubscribers(java.lang.String roomName)
                                              throws AdminException
        Returns all the subscribers (participants subscribed to a least one stream of another user) inside a room. A publisher is automatically subscribed to its own stream (loopback) and will not be included in the returned values unless it requests explicitly a connection to its own or another user’s stream.
        Parameters:
        roomName - name or identifier of the room
        Returns:
        set of UserParticipant POJOS representing the existing subscribers
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the room doesn’t exist

      • getPeerPublishers

        public java.util.Set<UserParticipant> getPeerPublishers(java.lang.String participantId)
                                                 throws AdminException
        Returns the peer’s publishers (participants from which the peer is receiving media). The own stream doesn’t count.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Returns:
        set of UserParticipant POJOS representing the publishers this participant is currently subscribed to
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist

      • getPeerSubscribers

        public java.util.Set<UserParticipant> getPeerSubscribers(java.lang.String participantId)
                                                  throws AdminException
        Returns the peer’s subscribers (participants towards the peer is streaming media). The own stream doesn’t count.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Returns:
        set of UserParticipant POJOS representing the participants subscribed to this peer
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist

      • isPublisherStreaming

        public boolean isPublisherStreaming(java.lang.String participantId)
                             throws AdminException
        Checks if a participant is currently streaming media.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Returns:
        true if the participant is streaming media, false otherwise
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist or has been closed

      • createRoom

        public void createRoom(KurentoClientSessionInfo sessionInfo)
                throws AdminException
        Creates a room if it doesn’t already exist. The room's name will be indicated by the session info bean.
        Parameters:
        sessionInfo - bean that will be passed to the KurentoClientProvider in order to obtain the KurentoClient that will be used by the room
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case of error while creating the room

      • closeRoom

        public void closeRoom(java.lang.String roomName)
               throws AdminException
        Closes an existing room by releasing all resources that were allocated for the room. Once closed, the room can be reopened (will be empty and it will use another Media Pipeline). Existing participants will be evicted.
        Dev advice: The room event handler should send notifications to the existing participants in the room to inform that the room was forcibly closed.
        Parameters:
        roomName - name or identifier of the room
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the room doesn’t exist or has been already closed

      • getPipeline

        public MediaPipeline getPipeline(java.lang.String participantId)
                          throws AdminException
        Returns the media pipeline used by the participant.
        Parameters:
        participantId - identifier of the participant
        Returns:
        the Media Pipeline object
        Throws:
        AdminException - in case the participant doesn’t exist
